analysis.name: Phylo Loop
analysis.script:
import json
import requests
import girder_worker
import girder_client

# create instance of the girder client
gc = girder_client.GirderClient(apiUrl='http://arbor.arborworkflows.com/girder/api/v1')
# lookup the analysis in a known location (the opentree collection)
methodToLoop = "Phylogenetic signal"
methodSearchResults = gc.resourceLookup('/collection/Default/Analyses/'+methodToLoop)
analysis = methodSearchResults['meta']['analysis']


aggregated_rows = []
mod_fields = []

for column in table['fields'][1:]:
    inputs = {
        'table': {'format': 'rows', 'data': table},
        'tree': {'format': 'r.apetree', 'data': tree},
        'column': {'format': 'text', 'data': column},
        'method': {'format': 'text', 'data': 'lambda'}
    }
    try:
        outputs = girder_worker.run(analysis, inputs, {'result': {'format': 'rows'}})
        part = outputs['result']['data']
    
        mod_rows = []
        mod_fields = ['Column']
        for row in part['rows']:
            mod_row = {'Column': column}
            for field in row:
                mod_field = field[(len(column) + 1):]
                mod_row[mod_field] = row[field]
                mod_fields.append(mod_field)
            mod_rows.append(mod_row)
        aggregated_rows += mod_rows
    except:
        pass

result = {
    'fields': mod_fields,
    'rows': aggregated_rows
}
